clinical_study.brief_title: Microwave Ablation for Pulmonary Metastases From Colorectal Cancer
clinical_study.official_title: CT-guided Percutaneous Microwave Ablation for Pulmonary Metastases From Colorectal Cancer

lead_sponsor.agency: The First People's Hospital of Changzhou

clinical_study.source: The First People's Hospital of Changzhou

brief_summary.textblock: (MWA) is the most recent development in the field of local ablative therapies. The aim of this study was to evaluate CT-guided percutaneous microwave (MW) ablation safety and efficacy in pulmonary metastases from colorectal cancer.

detailed_description.textblock: From June 2010 to June 2015, 48 unresectable lesions in 32 patients with pulmonary metastases from colorectal cancer were selected for CT-guided microwave ablation. Patients were scheduled for a 1 and 3 month CT follow-up to evaluate lesion diameter.We retrospectively evaluated CT-guided percutaneous microwave (MW) ablation safety and efficacy in pulmonary metastases from colorectal cancer.

arm_group.description: Patients undergoing MWA for pulmonary metastases from colorectal cancer.

intervention.description: pulmonary metastases from colorectal cancer are destructed/ablated using microwave ablation

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Unresectable pulmonary metastases from colorectal cancer.
- diagnosis by CT, and confirmed by percutaneous puncture biopsy.
- Age range 18-70 years old.
- Eastern Cooperative Oncology Group performance status 0-1.
- Life expectancy of more than 3 months.
- Adequate organ function.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Resectable lung metastases.
- Life expectancy less than 3 months
- Patients with cardiac pacemaker, cerebral aneurysm clips, implanted electronic instruments or other metal materials.
- Coagulopathy with platelet count less than 50000.
- Active infectious disease.
- Age below 18 years.
- Pregnancy of breastfeeding.
